text: laughter families having a good time
prosperous people with video cameras on
an afternoon out
not much different in north korea from
anywhere else except that here the
Workers Party oversees the dolphinarium
they say that North Korea's leader
guided the building's construction kim
jonghwan is credited with much by this
family
and you see they say that dolphins are
living under the warm care of our leader
kim jongwan this is North Korea's rising
middle class with leisure and money in a
changing country even in leisure time
here you can't get away from the party
that's a monument to the Workers Party
and the slogan says long live the
Workers Party in this immense square if
you look down the other side right at
the end there in the distance are two
statues to the founders Kim il-sung and
his son Kim jong-il their images
dominate this country and it's politics
here they are again this time a few
miles away but in miniature at a theme
park so sacred other images even here we
were barred from filming these girls are
just enjoying themselves but everything
in this country is under the eyes of the
Kim dynasty
this is a gala concert for the party
they found in 70 years ago and it's
packed with army officers loyal to Kim
Jong on the military top brass
celebrating its hold on power outside
for the people fireworks
how will Kim jong-un keep control of a
changing country where incomes and
aspirations are rising Stephen Evans BBC
news champion
